Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2011 08:19PM mamabooth wrote: You may have gotten more answers in the month but just in case.  I had my nipple/skin sparing surgery in 2/10.  I have had lots of pain in the non-cancer nipple also (most of the pain occured exactly one year after).  Both surgeons - cancer and plastic say it is totally normal.  They just advised that I apply pressure to the painful area until the pain subsides.  Sometimes this works.....sometimes this doesn't.  I have had other people in my circle of "cancer" friends who also have complained of the same thing.  Good news is that the pain has gone away and I haven't had any pain recently at all.  Hope this helps!
Posts.Title: nipple pain post skin/nipple sparing mastectomy chicagomom mamabooth
